question: The complex compounds [Co(NH₃)₅SO₄]Br and [Co(NH₃)₅Br]SO₄ are:
explanation: Ionisation isomers occur when the counter ion creates a potential ligand and displaces a ligand which becomes the counter ion.
Here, Sulphate (SO₄) is inside the sphere in one and outside in the other, exchanging with Bromide (Br). This is Ionisation Isomerism.
